Description: Fragment of a scarab, made of steatite, the left third of the scarab is preserved. Fine details carved, whitish-beige colour with incised lines filled with dark turquoise glaze. The division between elytra and prothorax is only indicated by a 1.6 mm long line. There was some sort of decoration on prothorax and also on elytra but most of it is broken off. The decoration on the elytra looks like a line of small parallel carved lines. Parts of the head visible, the left eye is preserved and well defined, clypeus is broken off. The side shows a circumferential line as stylised legs, with small vertical parallels lines to indicate the hair of the legs, this was carved in the area of the head and back. The seal at the base shows an oval line framing the base, in the middle something like a sunken rectangular field with rounded edges can be seen, the rest is broken off. To the outside of this field it a branchlike decoration. High quality. A small part of the longitudinal perforation is preserved.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), E14.6A, from room below E14.21
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 69)
